verses.content: I, Nephi, came back from talking with the Lord and went to my father's tent.
He said to me: "I had a dream. The Lord told me that you and your brothers have to go back to Jerusalem."
"Laban has the Jewish records and our family history. They're engraved on brass plates."
"The Lord wants you and your brothers to go to Laban's house, get the records, and bring them back here to the wilderness."
"Your brothers are complaining that this is too hard. But I'm not the one asking—this comes from the Lord."
"Go, my son. The Lord will bless you because you don't complain."
I told my father: "I'll go and do what the Lord commands. I know the Lord never asks us to do something without giving us a way to accomplish it."
When my father heard this, he was overjoyed. He knew the Lord had blessed me.
My brothers and I packed our tents and headed toward Jerusalem.
When we reached Jerusalem, we talked things over.
We cast lots to see who would go to Laban's house. The lot fell to Laman. He went to Laban's house and talked with him while Laban sat there.
He asked Laban for the brass plates that contained our family history.
Laban got angry and threw him out, saying: "You're a thief! I'll kill you!" He refused to give us the records.
Laman ran out and told us what happened. We were crushed. My brothers wanted to go back to our father in the wilderness.
But I said: "As surely as the Lord lives and we live, we're not going back to our father until we've done what the Lord commanded."
"Let's be faithful to the Lord's commands. Let's go get our father's inheritance—he left gold, silver, and all kinds of wealth. He left it all because the Lord told him to."
"He knew Jerusalem would be destroyed because of the people's wickedness."
"They rejected the prophets. If our father stayed there after God told him to leave, he would die too. He had to flee."
"It's God's wisdom that we get these records. We need to preserve our language for our children."
"We also need to preserve the words of all the holy prophets—everything God has revealed from the beginning of time until now."
This is how I convinced my brothers to keep God's commandments faithfully.
We went to our family property and gathered all our gold, silver, and valuable things.
After collecting everything, we went back up to Laban's house.
We went in and asked him to trade the brass plates for our gold, silver, and valuables.
When Laban saw how much wealth we had, he wanted it so badly that he threw us out and sent his servants to kill us and take our property.
We ran from Laban's servants. We had to abandon everything, and Laban took it all.
We escaped into the wilderness. The servants couldn't catch us, and we hid in a cave.
Laman was furious with me and our father. So was Lemuel—he always took Laman's side. They said harsh things to us younger brothers and beat us with a rod.

While they were beating us, an angel of the Lord appeared and stood before them. He said: "Why are you beating your younger brother with a rod? Don't you know the Lord has chosen him to lead you because of your sins? Go back to Jerusalem. The Lord will deliver Laban to you."
Then the angel left.
After the angel was gone, Laman and Lemuel started complaining again: "How can the Lord deliver Laban to us? He's powerful. He commands fifty men—he could kill fifty. So he could easily kill us."

headings.text: The Command to Get the Brass Plates
